<p>Our basic idea is to make a RC plane which can fly autonomously, along with having manual control on it.So, it is basically a autopilot system for RC plane.</p><p>For this purpose we plan to design two operational modes for flight which can be switched as per requirement:</p><p>1.<strong> Manual flight mode :</strong></p><p> Its the normal flight mode in which flight is controlled manually by radio controlled transmitter. So, take off and landing will be done in this mode.</p><p>further in case of any sudden failure of automated systems , we can switch to this mode to avoid any crashes in such emergency situation </p><p>.2. <strong>Automated flight mode:</strong></p><p>In this mode plane will be under the the control of autopilot , which here basically is a microcontoller program which contains a control algorithm</p><p>for flying (maintaining the heading and stability of)  the RC plane. So, in automated mode plane will holds its attitute, i.e. heading and stability of</p><p> the plane.</p><p>now the question is  how we are going to make an automated system as such???</p><p><img src="data:image/jpeg;base64,"></p><p><strong>WHAT WE NEED???</strong></p><p><strong>NEED1. </strong>We need some basis on which our automated system will work on, so that our plane will be able to hold its heading and stability.So in this case</p><p>our basis is the<strong> ORIENTATION </strong>of plane.so we need something which can give us the orientation of our rc plane.</p><p><strong>NEED2.</strong> we also need something that can read the orientation, do some calculation on orienation data and order the servo motor to tilt the control surface</p><p> by reqired amount to get the plane in desired heading.</p><p>so, we are going to use an inertial measurement unit(IMU) and microcontroller for this purpose.</p><p><img src="http://playground.arduino.cc/uploads/Main/mpu-6050.jpg" style="width: 177px;"></p><p><strong>IMU:</strong></p><p>An IMU is a MEMS device which has accelerometer and gyroscopes fitted on it, so accelerometer provides the acceleration (not exactly acceleration </p><p>but acceleration relative to a freely falling frame) and gyroscope provies the angular velocity of the object .</p><p>we are using an IMU called as <strong>MPU-6050, </strong>which has a 3 axis acceelerometer and 3 axis gyroscope in it.</p><p><strong>USE OF IMU:</strong></p><p>In our project we are using IMU to calculate the orientation of our plane and hence our first need.Here orientation means roll, pitch and yaw angles of our</p><p> rc plane.How to get orientation is described later.</p><p><img src="data:image/jpeg;base64,"></p><p><strong>MICROCONTROLLER(MCU):</strong></p><p>It is an electronic chip that can read and write digital and analog signals on its pins and can be programmed to do computational tasks on those digital and analog datas.</p><p><strong>USE OF MCU:</strong></p><p>we can fulfill our second need from this device, which can read orientation data from imu and send singnals to acctuate the servos of control surface of </p><p>our rc plane.</p><p>we are using a microcontroller known as <strong>ARDUINO UNO</strong> for our purpose.</p>
